ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: You learn a good bit of conversational Chinese. I feel pretty comfortable saying, reading, and writing a number of very useful things.
Introductory chinese grammar, characters and words.
Learned over 300 Chinese characters, and how to speak and read elementary Chinese.

Most of the insights I developed in this course pertained to how to learn a language in a college setting rather than the specific vocabulary and grammar we studied. While there were several language gains made in the course, modeling how to (and how not to) learn a language was I think the most significant portion of the course.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: An amazing course! No weaknesses. I think the class is structured in a way that allows a student to really learn Chinese and basic phrases and grammar.

Strengths: strong curriculum, constant reinforcement of learning, energetic and engaging class time.
Weaknesses: lack of support, work not always commensurate with learning. Definitely making students more aware of the language tutor option, for instance

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes.  It's intense but they teach you so much, and it's useful for daily life to know.

This course is a very tough sell. If you are really willing to spend a 3-4 hours each day working on Chinese, then you will get a lot out of this course. But, I think for many people (especially those with no experience) the workload and the pace of this course can be very draining.
Yes. Moves very quickly and is pretty challenging but you learn so much and get off to a great foundation in the language.
Yes. I really enjoyed learning this language. My professor made sure everyone could understand and speak the language and was very caring with her teaching.
I would absolutely recommend this - it is a very effective, if time consuming way of learning Chinese.
Yes! Just be prepared to work

Yes definitely 100% Chinese at Yale is one of the most well taught departments here. All the instructors are so kind and helpful. They want to see you succeed, and the intensity of the course makes it so that you actually learn the language by the end of the semester.

Definitely. On the strength of the curriculum and the intimate class sessions, I think the possible gains in language ability outweigh the deficiencies in support and make the high course load worth it.
